components.description:
A friendly, cartoon-styled face of a cow looking straight ahead. Variously depicted as a white, brown, or multicolored cow face with a neutral expression, short horns, and a pink or brown muzzle.

Often used with a more affectionate tone than the full-bodied üêÑ Cow.

Facebook’s design once featured a more lifelike, brown cow face.
components.title: Cow Face

description:
A friendly, cartoon-styled face of a cow looking straight ahead. Variously depicted as a white, brown, or multicolored cow face with a neutral expression, short horns, and a pink or brown muzzle.

Often used with a more affectionate tone than the full-bodied üêÑ Cow.

Facebook’s design once featured a more lifelike, brown cow face.
title: Cow Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal faces
emoji_net_data.definition: A friendly-looking cow face, looking straight ahead. Cow Face was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Co http://emojipedia.org/cow-face/
emoji_net_data.name: cow face

bn:00090506v: Of a cow or bull, to make its characteristic lowing sound.
Make a low noise, characteristic of bovines

bn:00090780v: To draw milk from (a mammal, especially a cow).
To express milk from (a mammal, especially a cow).

bn:00054026n: The edible flesh of animals, especially that of mammals.
Meat is the flesh of an animal which is eaten.
Meat is animal flesh that is eaten as food.
The flesh of an animal used as food.
The flesh of animals (including fishes and birds and snails) used as food

bn:00054996n: A white nutritious liquid secreted by mammals and used as food by human beings
Milk is a white liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals.
Milk that contains at least 3.5% fat.
The whitish fluid secreted by the mammary gland for the nourishment of the young; composed of carbohydrates, proteins, fats, mineral salts, vitamins, and antibodies.
Nutrient-rich liquids secreted by the mammary glands of female mammals
White liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals

A white liquid produced by the mammary glands of female mammals to nourish their young. From certain animals, especially cows, it is a common food for humans as a beverage or used to produce various dairy products such as butter, cheese, and yogurt.

bn:00059960n: Any bovine animal used as a beast of burden.
An ox, also known as a bullock in Australia, New Zealand and India, is a bovine trained as a draft animal.
Any bovine animal (tribe Bovini) used as a beast of burden
An adult castrated bull of the genus Bos; especially Bos taurus

bn:00023381n: Female of domestic cattle: "`moo-cow' is a child's term"

bn:00055805n: The sound made by a cow or bull
The characteristic sound made by a cow or bull.
Sound made by a cow or bull.
